items.text: length, spins in on middle, pushed to long-off
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Sikandar Raza, 1 run

items.text: short and wide, tries to slap it away and extra cover dives to his right and stops it
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Williams, 1 run

items.text: short, spins in, backs away and cuts to cover
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.text: full on middle and leg, driven to extra cover
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.text: pitched up on leg, clipped to midwicket
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.text: short of length on middle and leg, punched down the ground
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Williams, no run

items.text: full on middle and leg, gets an inside edge to deep fine leg as he drives at it
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Williams, 1 run

items.text: walks down the ground and slaps this short ball to cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sikandar Raza, 1 run

items.text: short of a length on off, angled in, pulled away to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Williams, 1 run

items.text: back of a length, opens the face and guides to point
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.text: defends a length ball down the ground
items.postText: Alright then. Zimbabwe are primed for a 300-plus total. The key: don't lose wickets. Can they? Debayan is here to find out with you.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.preText: "Has Bangladesh misjudged the track and chose to bowl?? Questions in my mind!! So far so good for Zimbabwe.." -- Oldest, and truest adage of the game, Sunny, is never to judge a pitch until both teams have batted on it.
items.text: short and pulled away, but towards a sweeper. Just a single
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Williams, 1 run

items.text: driven down the on-side, where midwicket comes across and pulls off a stop. Enough to prevent a run
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.text: backed up well by short midwicket again. A drive, but for no runs
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.text: the ball cuts into him, and he backs away and pushes it towards cover for a single
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Sikandar Raza, 1 run

items.text: right into the blockhole, and Williams can't do anything other than pat it away
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Williams, no run

items.text: driven straight, half-stopped by the bowler, and the ricochet doesn't go far enough to allow any runs
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Williams, no run

items.text: driven towards mid-off, and a bit to the left. Ample time for the batsmen to go through for a single
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sikandar Raza, 1 run

items.preText: james: "The dew played a significant role in the last match --- ZIM fielders were scrambling to keep the ball dry by the 5th over of BD's chase, so I doubt BD made the wrong call batting 2nd. However, they still need to keep ZIM's total down as much as possible here. No Tamims or Shakibs to bring them out of jail. BD top order is as shaky as ever."
items.text: short and pulled it away beautifully. Just a good bit of timing, and did well to play it in front of square through the vacant mid-wicket region. Just 17 away from a century here
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Williams, FOUR runs

items.text: slightly slower off-cutter and Williams plays it to the off-side. There's a shy at the stumps, and the batsmen are able to take an overthrow after the ball just misses the stumps. Would have been a close one had it hit
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Williams, 1 run

items.text: moves across the stumps and flicks it in the air but into the gap. Finds a man in the deep, but enough time to pick up two. Sensible batting
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sikandar Raza, 2 runs

items.text: width on offer, and he hits it well. Goes straight to Soumya Sarkar at mid-off and quickly. No chance for any runs
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.text: tapped away to the off with an open face of the bat and soft hands. They have done well to pick up an extra run for the overthrow. Some ragged work from Bangladesh in the field
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sikandar Raza, 2 runs

items.preText: Tasmeem: "Good for Mashrafe to be stuck with Mahmudullah here. As Ariful, Soumya and Ariful aren't bowling well, it's imperative he finishes his full quota." -- Agree. Probably too good a bowler to not bowl his full quota more often anyway.
items.text: short and flicked away on the onside. Two runs on offer as the man sweeping has a fair amount of ground to cover
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Williams, 2 runs

items.text: good stop off his own bowling. Williams hit that well. but he was quick to cut it off
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Williams, no run
